title: Email format & email content changed.
content: Yesterday, March 12 my incoming e-mails were of a 'normal' format; this morning the entire format had changed --background colouring gone and access to some business reminders of appointments etc not available. e.g. Your Next Door Neighbor I was no longer able to click on link to access their site. My eye care provider reminder email I wasn't able to access the book appointment link. I hadn't altered/touched/changed anything before this morning. Please advise what has happened. Phyllis Masson
creator: pemasson

title: My tbird account on my own website causes my hosting company to block my ip about once a month for the last 6 month
content:
For the last 6 months, my ip gets blocked from my website server about once a month. This causes me to locked out of my website until inmotion unblocks my ip. It works fine for about a month and then ip blocked again The conversation below was with my hosting company Inmotion hosting

4:35:48 PM) Andrea J.: Looking at the error, I can only see failed logins for alan@wood-r-us.com. (4:36:02 PM) Andrea J.: I have unblocked the IP for you. (4:36:16 PM) Andrea J.: So you should be able to access the server now. (4:36:54 PM) Alan Johnston: Yes my email is working again thanks. (4:36:59 PM) Andrea J.: My pleasure. Was there anything else I could assist with today? (4:37:20 PM) Alan Johnston: What can be done so this does not keep happening about every month (4:38:32 PM) Andrea J.: You will need to locate the device that is having the login issue, (4:39:14 PM) Alan Johnston: That is the only email related to this site and It is me. I use thunderbird and I stay logged in all the time (4:40:11 PM) Andrea J.: Mar 13 15:49:30 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Connection closed: read(size=720) failed: Connection reset by peer (no auth attempts in 3 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85, TLS: read(size=720) failed: Connection reset by peer, TLSv1.2 with cipher ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 (256/256 bits) Mar 13 15:49:31 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Connection closed (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85, TLS handshaking: Connection closed Mar 13 15:49:31 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Too many invalid commands (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85 Mar 13 15:49:31 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Connection closed (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85 Mar 13 15:49:31 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Connection closed (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85, TLS: Connection closed, TLSv1.2 with cipher ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384 (256/256 bits) Mar 13 15:49:32 ecbiz320 dovecot: imap-login: Disconnected: Connection closed (no auth attempts in 1 secs): user=<>, rip=172.58.1.223, lip=209.182.196.85, TLS handshaking: Connection closed (4:40:37 PM) Andrea J.: Looking at the server, the logs shows connection errors. (4:40:56 PM) Andrea J.: You may need to look into ThunderBird to see if there is an update that is needed. (4:41:17 PM) Andrea J.: If your IP is repeatedly being blocked, there is an issue with the mail client's connection.

title: Moving Data in Thunderbird
content:
I have an old computer with email from an account that the name@domain is still a valid email address but I moved servers. The account on that computer is pointing to a server that doesn't exist anymore. I have a new Thunderbird account on the new computer with that same email address pointing to a new server. If I use the Import/Export feature and copy over the profile and import the account to the new computer will it mess up the connection to the new server? I just want to merge the old emails with the new ones so I don't have to look in two different computers to see my old emails. Otherwise can I rename the account on the old computer before I copy it and import it to the new computer?

As an alternative, can I copy over the entire old profile to the new computer and then just "switch" profiles when I want to look at the old emails? If so how would I switch profiles?

Please provide some detailed instructions on how to do this.
creator: junkmmc

title: Loss of a Thunderbird archive sub folder
content:
Hi

I have a number of category folders under 'Archives' and then sub category folders under some of those. One is for archiving emails from my energy supplier. They were recently taken over by another company, so I changed the name of the sub folder to reflect that. All seemed OK until I had to restart the computer as a result of a Windows update. Now that renamed folder has completely disappeared. I can do a search in Archives for a known email from them, and it is found, but the location just shows as the new name of the sub folder - no clue as to where that sub folder is now hiding ...

Any thoughts how to find it and put it back where it belongs, anyone ?

Thanks

title: Thunderbird and emails not showing
content: This is the second time I have had to downgrade Thunderbird because of my emails not showing. Any of them no matter what folder. Last time it happened I skipped an upgrade and everything worked properly but I only hope the same applies this time. I have used Thunderbird for must be over 20 years so not a newbie. Fedora 39 (64Bit) with all current updates and Thunderbird 115.3.1 (64-bit) after downgrading from 115.8.1. Years ago I contemplated writing my own email client but decided against it. Two things in programming KISS = keep it simple stupid and if it isn't broken DON'T fix it. Thunderbird for me had been rock solid for so many years that I am now very disappointed. Thanks though to all the good programmers of the past
creator: mikebartnz

title: I had set up an openPGP key but never used it, deleted it, now many messages in my saved folder are encrypted and inaccessible
content: I am using TB 115.8.1 on Ubuntu. I had set up an openPGP key for my main address but never used it. When I created templates to use for OoO as per https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1126211 I found that the OoO reply messages (even for a different address) were attaching the key. Stupidly with hindsight, I deleted the key. Now I find that many but not all the messages in my saved folder won't open as TB says, correctly, that the key is not accessible. However, I never asked TB to encrypt these messages. I also still can't get an "Autocrype: addr=" out of the replies using some of the OoO templates I created. At least for me the openPGP is pretty fundamentally broken and has lost me content and time. I like TB but this is seriously frustrating. Perhaps this is a useful warning to others.
creator: cpsyctc

title: TB won't synchronizing contact to Gmail.
content:
I've tried following the instructions from this link. https://ekiwi-blog.de/en/25881/synchronize-google-calendar-and-contacts-with-thunderbird-without-addons/

Basically, you add a new CardDAV Address Book; and then use this link as the location https://www.googleapis.com/carddav/v1/principals/myemail@gmail.com/lists/default/ P.S I did change "myemail@gmail.com" to my actual email address.

It fetches contacts from Gmail but it won't upload contacts from TB to Gmail; which is what I need TB to do so that I can keep contacts synchronizes across multiple laptops. I only add contacts from TB and won't use Gmail to add new contacts.

Is there a something that I need to set within Gmail to get this to work or it is just not possible at the moment to synchronize in both directions?

Qualcuno ha qualche soluzione?

creator: chatogenata

title: No Prompt to Save Draft Before Closing Window
content:
Typically, when you're writing a draft and try to close the draft window it will ask if you want to save it first. However, when one of my applications sends data to Thunderbird with prefilled TO, SUBJECT, and MESSAGE fields (and I make no edits to the draft window) it no longer (as of 115 release) prompts me to save the draft when closing the window. If I revise this draft in any way (adding a space to the end of the subject field) it will prompt me when closing.

My workflow consists of saving drafts without any edits needed to the compose window. This used to work fine prior to the 115 release, but now I need to add the space to each draft or hit save and wait 3-5 seconds (to communicate with the server) before I can close the window. Small inconvenience, but is this really the desired action? (imagine someone closes a draft window with data in it, thinking the draft is already saved, and it's simply gone)
creator: imsaborda

title: nem sikerül a gmail postafiókot hozzáadni a Thunderbird-höz
content: Egy új eszközön próbálom a Thunderbird-höz hozzáadni a gmail-es postafiókomat. Az adatok (Név, email cím, jelszó) megadása után kiírja, hogy "A konfiguráció megtalálható a Mozilla ISP adatbázisában". Az elérhető konfigurációk közül az IMAP-ot választom, majd a KÉSZ gomb megnyomása és némi várakozás után hibaüzenetet kapok: "Nem sikerült bejelentkezni a kiszolgálóra. Valószínűleg rossz a konfiguráció, a felhasználónév vagy a jelszó." Biztos, hogy a jelszó jó, külön ellenőriztem a belépést a Google fiókomba. Mi lehet a probléma? Nagyon köszönöm, ha valaki tud segíteni!
creator: molnar.gyorgy.m

title: Thunderbird is STILL squirrely & functions inconsistently, aka effed up.
content:
Thunderbird is misbehaving egregiously this morning which is something it seems to regularly do. Today it is once again doing this:

  • going through email, I click on a message which marks it read and then I move it to a folder
  • do this with 10 or 15 emails
  • then suddenly all of the recently read & moved emails reappear back in the inbox unread
  • after a few minutes, the messages, without any input from me, start to SLOOOOWLY, one by one, mark themselves read and disappear from the inbox, which can take several minutes
  • if I check the folder where I moved a message, it's still there even when it appears back in the inbox, if I click on the message in the inbox & move it to the folder again (which can only be done sometimes), I then have two copies of the message in the folder

Also, sometimes the email message view won't change. I click on a message & it shows in the view pane, then I click on a different message in the inbox & the previous message is still in the view pane, fully functional, scrollable, etc. I have killed & restarted Thunderbird many times this morning and these behaviors still keep occurring. Also also, why does Thunderbird hog my CPU cycles? Sometimes, for extended periods, it will be using ~50% of my CPU when I not even working in Thunderbird, & I know it's not compacting because I've told it not to. In spite of knowing about issues for a long time (some of which I, and others, have previously reported), the Thunderbird team seems incapable or unwilling to fix these problems. What's really frustrating is that Thunderbird didn't used to have these issues, they only appeared after an "upgrade" which occurred about five months ago.
creator: geodave50

creator: georgehrosenberg

title: Missing Folder/Sub-folder Content
content:
Background: I've been using Thunderbird for several months (since about Thanksgiving(?) 2023), about the time MS started migrating to their "new" Outlook. That's background, as a way of saying that I do not exactly know when my issue first occurred. It quite possibly could have occurred when I first started with Thunderbird, or some time between then and now.

Now the issue! One of my folders in the folder view, and all its 12 sub-folders, have nothing in them! One of the sub-folders on the folder view indicates there are 17 unread emails, but the folder is empty. That's the issue that I need to rectify. Is there a way to "re-download" the contents of a specific folder and all its sub-folders?

I have right-clicked on the primary folder and selected "properties" and tried to "repair folder", without success. The Location field on properties is: imap://pgstuder%40charter.net@mobile.charter.net/A%20-%20Family/Mary%20%28ID%29

That's the only solution I have tried, or which I thought might solve the problem. The only other possible solution I thought might work was to delete the account and reload, but I did not want to go through all the hassle. Please help.

Questions I thought I might need to answer: Yes, the Charter/Spectrum email server is populated with the emails I'm searching for. So, yes, they are there. I just need to get them downloaded to Thunderbird. Second, the name of the folder is "Mary (ID)", without the quotes. Could the () be causing a problem? Do I need to rename it on the server? And if so, then what's the next step? All of the sub-folders have names with no special characters.

Appreciate any help you can provide, Pete Studer

3/19/2024 Update: The Charter email server must have changed its folder naming criteria at some point during my email adventures. I simply removed the ( and ) from the folder name and after closing Thunderbird and starting again, the database populated all the folders correctly.

Problem Solved.

title: Archive from local folders to archive in local folders no longer works
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 115.8.1 (64-bit). On Jan. 29 I left the beta program after several years to return to the release version because of problems with the beta at that time.

Last year, still in TB Beta, I had switched my two email accounts from POP to IMAP. At that time I moved all my mail folders (except inbox, trash, and other system folders), and about 14 years of archives, to the Local Folders account to avoid the cost of storing them on a mail server. There were no problems. At year end I archived my 2023 emails from my folders in Local Folders to my archive in Local Folders, preserving the folder structure, and everything worked normally.

When I left TB Beta a month later I tried to replicate my folders, including the archive folder, in the new profile for TB 115. Then I manually moved folders from my TB beta profile to my new profile folder (C:/Users/billf/AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/84xm6dz9.default-release/Mail/Local Folders/). The folders showed up within Thunderbird, then some of them disappeared briefly but then reappeared. A few days later about 80% of my folders, including the archive folder, vanished completely and haven't returned. I checked the file system and they were gone.

Today I tried again, restoring several .sbd folders and .msf files - most importantly the archive - from my HD backup from mid-February when everything had seemed to be working. They're still in the file system - so far - but none of these folders are now visible in TB. The account settings for Local Folders don't mention archiving at all.

I hope someone can tell me how to get my old folders and especially the archive back, and stable. (As I rebuild my folder structure in TB I'm giving the folders new names so they won't be overwritten if my folders from January come back.)
creator: billfalls1
